channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: With pharaoh-fanfare, Egypt unveils a huge new museum dedicated to its ancient civilization
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — In an extravaganza of pharaonic imagery with a drone light show depicting ancient gods and pyramids in the sky, Egypt on Saturday inaugurated its long-delayed Grand Egyptian Museum, a megaproject aiming to give the country’s millennia-old heritage a rich, modern display.
item.dc:creator: SAMY MAGDY, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Hegseth declines to discuss possible US strikes in Venezuela, blames Dems on troop pay amid shutdown
item.description: Secretary of War Pete Hegseth declined to say whether the U.S. is preparing military strikes on Venezuela, while blasting Democrats over the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Former Kentucky Gov. Martha Layne Collins has died at 88
item.description: LEXINGTON, Ky. (AP) — Martha Layne Collins, the first and only woman elected governor of Kentucky, died on Saturday. She was 88.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: How does 'doomscrolling' actually affect us? Experts weigh in
item.description: While it may feel relaxing to put one's mind on pause and endless scroll the feed of a favorite app, experts are urging people to beware of certain warning signs.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Supplements sold at Sam's Club nationwide linked to salmonella outbreak: FDA
item.description: Illnesses connected to using the product have been reported in Kansas, Florida, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, New York and Michigan. Three people who contracted salmonella were hospitalized, according to the CDC.
item.dc:creator: Kyler Swaim, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Judges order SNAP funding to continue as shutdown threatens food assistance for many Illinois families
item.description: Two federal judges ruled that the Trump administration must continue funding SNAP during the government shutdown, using contingency dollars if necessary, to ensure that the 2 million Illinoisans who rely on the program can access healthy food.
item.dc:creator: Julian Crews, WGN 9

item.title: Controversy over Tucker Carlson interview reveals conservative movement's conflict over antisemitism
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — As Republicans accuse Democrats of tolerating antisemitism in their party, the GOP on Friday was roiled by its own schism after the leader of a powerful right-wing think tank defended prominent conservative commentator Tucker Carlson for his friendly podcast interview with a far-righ
item.dc:creator: NICHOLAS RICCARDI, JILL COLVIN and THOMAS BEAUMONT, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs transferred to New Jersey prison to serve 4-year prostitution-related sentence
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Sean “Diddy” Combs has been transferred to a prison in New Jersey to serve out the remainder of his four-year prison sentence on prostitution-related charges.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Monkey escape in Mississippi gives a glimpse into the secretive world of animal research
item.description: The recent escape of several research monkeys after the truck carrying them overturned on a Mississippi interstate is the latest glimpse into the secretive industry of animal research and the processes that allow key details of what happened to be kept from the public.
item.dc:creator: JEFF MARTIN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Young adults turn to Quakers' silent worship to offset
item.description: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — At the Arch Street Meeting House in Philadelphia's Old City, more and more young people are seeking respite from a clamorous technological age in the silent worship of a centuries-old faith. Like other Quaker houses of worship, it follows values of simplicity and equality.
item.dc:creator: LUIS ANDRES HENAO, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Escaped monkeys from Mississippi truck crash puts spotlight on NIH-funded Tulane lab
item.description: Three monkeys remain at large after truck crash in Mississippi released 21 primates from Tulane University research program allegedly funded by NIH, sparking public safety concerns.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Wisconsin judge puts on hold ruling that required citizenship check of voters
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A Wisconsin judge on Friday put on hold his order that requires elections officials to verify the citizenship of all 3.6 million registered voters in the battleground state before the next statewide election in February.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Last-minute scramble over pay takes a toll on military families during the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The government shutdown is exacting a heavy mental toll on the nation's military families, leaving them not knowing from week to week whether their paychecks will arrive.
item.dc:creator: BEN FINLEY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Blood pressure medication recalled over potential carcinogen: What to know
item.description: Nearly 590,000 bottles of blood pressure drugs have been recalled over concerns that they may contain a potentially carcinogenic chemical that exceeds the “acceptable intake limit.
item.dc:creator: Michael Bartiromo, KRON4

item.title: Mamdani leading, New Jersey governor candidates virtually tied in new Emerson College Poll: Political Power Ranker
item.description: (WHTM) - A new poll shows Zohran Mamdani with a strong lead in the New York City mayoral race, while the election for Governor of New Jersey remains hotly contested.
item.dc:creator: George Stockburger, WGN 9

item.title: The Latest: Trump administration must fund SNAP payments during the shutdown, judges rule
item.description: Federal judges have ruled that the Trump administration must continue funding SNAP during the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Fast chargers are expanding quickly, but American EV drivers still fear running out of juice
item.description: KENT, Conn. (AP) — For most Americans, there’s less reason than ever to worry about finding chargers to fuel up an electric vehicle. But charging worries remain a top hesitation for potential buyers, second only to sticker shock. Those concerns linger even as fast chargers multiply.
item.dc:creator: M.K. WILDEMAN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: DC Mayor Bowser says residents will receive SNAP, WIC benefits in November
item.description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) on Thursday said the city will fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and the separate program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) for the month of November amid the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, WGN 9

item.title: Photos: Trumps host Halloween event at White House
item.description: President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted trick-or-treaters on Thursday in a Halloween celebration that has become a fun White House tradition.
item.dc:creator: The Hill, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Why some schools have been spooked out of Halloween
item.description: Religion, politics and student participation are all among the reasons some schools have abandoned Halloween celebrations that put candy-filled children in bulky costumes in classrooms.
item.dc:creator: Lexi Lonas Cochran, WFLA, NBC

item.title: A 3rd teenager is indicted for the killing of a congressional intern in Washington
item.description: A third teenager has been arrested and charged with the killing of a congressional intern in the nation's capital, a crime that President Donald Trump cited when he announced a law enforcement surge in Washington.
item.dc:creator: AUDREY McAVOY, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: 2 die in flooded New York City basements during heavy rainstorm
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Two people died in flooded New York City basements Thursday during a rainstorm that shut down roadways and caused airport delays, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Tracking the storm: NYC flood warning, rain totals and wind gusts
item.description: NEW YORK CITY (PIX11) — A nasty storm is making its way through New York City. Flood warning NYC The National Weather Service issued a flood warning for Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and the Bronx Thursday afternoon through 5:30 p.m on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Gustafson, NewsNation

item.title: Man, 39, dies after being pulled from flooded Brooklyn basement: NYPD
item.description: EAST FLATBUSH, Brooklyn (PIX11) — A man died after he was pulled from a flooded basement in Brooklyn as New York City was hit with a historic storm, according to the NYPD. A call came in for a reported person trapped in a flooded basement at 564 Kingston Ave. in East Flatbush at 4:25 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Video credit: Zhané Caldwell, NewsNation

item.title: Utah man accused of throwing 6 puppies out of car on highway, killing 2 of them
item.description: Memphis Lor, 25, was arrested on seven counts of torturing a companion animal, a third-degree felony. He has not been formally charged.
item.dc:creator: Sorina Trauntvein, NewsNation

item.title: Putin claims Russian troops have surrounded 2 Ukrainian cities but Ukraine says that's not true
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russian President Vladimir Putin claimed Wednesday that Russian troops have surrounded Ukrainian forces in two key eastern cities of Ukraine and offered to negotiate a deal for their surrender. Ukrainian military officials vigorously denied the claim.
item.dc:creator: ILLIA NOVIKOV, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Here's how tariffs could impact holiday shopping season: Analysis
item.description: If current tariffs had been in place last year, consumers would have faced a $28.6 billion burden, a new analysis finds.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dorn, WGN 9

item.title: Taco kits recalled in 27 states over 'life-threatening' seasoning mix-up: FDA
item.description: The taco seasoning packets didn't contain taco seasoning, according to the company that produced the kits.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Langenfeld, Fox 5

item.title: GM lays off 1,700 workers at plants in Michigan and Ohio amid slower EV demand
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — General Motors is laying off about 1,700 workers across manufacturing sites in Michigan and Ohio, as the auto giant adjusts to slowing demand for electric vehicles.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: HHS fires top official who was critical of COVID shots
item.description: The Trump administration over the weekend fired Steven Hatfill, a senior advisor to the administration who opposed the COVID-19 vaccines and promoted the use of hydroxychloroquine during the pandemic.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Choi, WGN 9

item.title: Video shows dramatic rescue of woman from car submerged in South Carolina pond
item.description: HORRY COUNTY, S.C. (WBTW) – Video obtained by Nexstar's WBTW shows South Carolina first responders and bystanders rescuing a woman from a car partially submerged in a pond along a highway bypass in Horry County Tuesday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Dennis Bright, WGN 9

item.title: Rappeller dies in Zion National Park's Pine Creek Canyon
item.description: A 58-year-old man died at the last rappel of Zion National Park's Pine Creek Canyon on Sunday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Ava Hart, Fox 5
